topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack 1.0: Remove a Proxy Node

body.p: It is recommended that you gradually reduce the weight in the ring and change the disk in the Swift cluster to avoid poor performance.
Scale-out Proxy nodes can only be removed from the cloud after all the disks have been removed from the node.

li.xref: Identify the disks of the node to be removed
Copying the rings to other nodes
Removing the haproxy configuration from each of the Overcloud Controller nodes
Remove the scale-out proxy node by removing the corresponding stack

ul.li: HP Helion OpenStack cloud is successfully deployed.(Starter Swift nodes are functional by default as they are part of cloud deployment.)
The scale-out Object Ring-1 has been deployed.
At least one scale-out proxy node has been deployed.
All of the rings generated must be preserved, preferably at more than one location. Swift needs these rings to be consistent across all nodes.
Take a backup of the rings before any operation.

section.title: Identify the disks of the node to be removed
section.p: Perform the following steps to identify the disks of the node to be removed:

li.p: Log in to the undercloud from seed.
Change the directory to ring builder.
Identify the builder file for account and container rings. It will be account.builder and container.builder.
List the disks in the current account.builder and container.builder files.
Recommendation:
Remove drives gradually using a weighted approach to avoid degraded performance of the Swift cluster. The weight will gradually decrease by 25% until it becomes 0%. The initial weight is 75.
Set the weight of the disk for account.builder and container.builderfiles.

codeblock.codeph: # ringos set-weight -f account.builder -s d<device> -w <weight> # ringos set-weight -f container.builder -s d<device> -w <weight>

li.p: Re-balance the ring.

codeblock.codeph: # ringos rebalance-ring -f account.builder # ringos rebalance-ring -f container.builder

li.p: Note: You must wait for the time specified by min_part_hours before another re-balance succeeds.
List all the Swift nodes.
Copy account.ring.gz and container.ring.gz files to all nodes.

codeblock.codeph: # ringos copy-ring -s /root/ring-building/account.ring.gz -n <Swift nodes IP address> # ringos copy-ring -s /root/ring-building/container.ring.gz -n <Swift nodes IP address>

li.p: You can also copy the account and container ring files to all the swift nodes using the following commands:

codeblock.codeph: # ringos copy-ring -s /root/ring-building/account.ring.gz -n all # ringos copy-ring -s /root/ring-building/container.ring.gz -n all

li.p: Repeat steps from 5-8 decreasing the weight by 25 each time; set the weight to 50, 25, and finally 0 (w= 50, 25, 0). These steps should be repeated until the weight becomes 0 for each disk.
Verify the account.builder and container.builder files.

section.title: Removing disk from the ring

li.p: Once weight is set to 0, remove the disk from the ring.

codeblock.codeph: # ringos remove-disk-from-ring -f account.builder -s d<device> # ringos remove-disk-from-ring -f container.builder -s d<device>

section.p: Repeat this step for each disk of the specific node.

li.p: Re-balance the ring.

codeblock.codeph: # ringos rebalance-ring -f container.builder # ringos rebalance-ring -f account.builder

li.p: Verify the ring content.

section.title: Copy the rings to other nodes

li.p: List all the Swift nodes.
Copy account.ring.gz and container.ring.gz files to all the nodes.

codeblock.codeph: # ringos copy-ring -s /root/ring-building/account.ring.gz -n <Swift nodes of IP address> # ringos copy-ring -s /root/ring-building/container.ring.gz -n <Swift nodes of IP address>

section.title: Remove the haproxy configuration from each of the overcloud Controller nodes

li.p: Edit swift-proxy.cfg on each of the controller nodes.
Remove the following content in the swift-proxy.cfg file.

codeblock.codeph: listen scale_swift_proxy bind 192.0.2.21:8080 server <Proxy node hostname> <Proxy nodes IP address of >:8080 check inter 2000 rise 2 fall 5

li.p: Note:You will have the number of "server" lines equal to number of Swift proxies you have setup.
Restart HA proxy service on all these nodes.
